verses.verse: And it came to pass, that after <WH6256> the year <WH8141> was expired <WH8666>, at the time <WH6256> that kings <WH4428> go out <WH3318> to battle, Joab <WH3097> led forth <WH5090> the power <WH2428> of the army <WH6635>, and wasted <WH7843> the country <WH776> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, and came <WH935> and besieged <WH6696> Rabbah <WH7237>. But David <WH1732> tarried <WH3427> at Jerusalem <WH3389>. And Joab <WH3097> smote <WH5221> Rabbah <WH7237>, and destroyed <WH2040> it. after: Heb. at the return of the year

And David <WH1732> took <WH3947> the crown <WH5850> of their king <WH4428> from off his head <WH7218>, and found <WH4672> it to weigh <WH4948> a talent <WH3603> of gold <WH2091>, and there were precious <WH3368> stones <WH68> in it; and it was set upon David's <WH1732> head <WH7218>: and he brought <WH3318> also exceeding <WH3966> much <WH7235> spoil <WH7998> out of the city <WH5892>. to weigh: Heb. the weight of

And he brought out <WH3318> the people <WH5971> that were in it, and cut <WH7787> them with saws <WH4050>, and with harrows <WH2757> of iron <WH1270>, and with axes <WH4050>. Even so dealt <WH6213> David <WH1732> with all the cities <WH5892> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>. And David <WH1732> and all the people <WH5971> returned <WH7725> to Jerusalem <WH3389>.

And it came to pass after this <WH310>, that there arose <WH5975> war <WH4421> at Gezer <WH1507> with the Philistines <WH6430>; at which time <WH227> Sibbechai <WH5444> the Hushathite <WH2843> slew <WH5221> Sippai <WH5598>, that was of the children <WH3211> of the giant <WH7497>: and they were subdued <WH3665>. arose: or, continued: Heb. stood Gezer: or, Gob the giant: or, Rapha

And there was war <WH4421> again with the Philistines <WH6430>; and Elhanan <WH445> the son <WH1121> of Jair <WH3265> slew <WH5221> Lahmi <WH3902> the brother <WH251> of Goliath <WH1555> the Gittite <WH1663>, whose spear <WH2595> staff <WH6086> was like a weaver's <WH707> beam <WH4500>. Jair: called also, Iaare-ore-gim.2. Sam.21.19

And yet again there was war <WH4421> at Gath <WH1661>, where was a man <WH376> of great stature <WH4060>, whose fingers <WH676> and toes <WH676> were four <WH702> and twenty <WH6242>, six <WH8337> on each hand, and six <WH8337> on each foot: and he also was the son <WH3205> of the giant <WH7497>. great: Heb. a man of measure the son: Heb. born to the giants, or, Rapha
But when he defied <WH2778> Israel <WH3478>, Jonathan <WH3083> the son <WH1121> of Shimea <WH8092> David's <WH1732> brother <WH251> slew <WH5221> him. defied: or, reproached Shimea: called Shammah
These <WH411> were born <WH3205> unto the giant <WH7497> in Gath <WH1661>; and they fell <WH5307> by the hand <WH3027> of David <WH1732>, and by the hand <WH3027> of his servants <WH5650>.
